_header: Lord of us Thou have meaning
Subjects: Christ, prayers to; prayers, to Christ

BLHar1260.First Lines: Lorde os us thou haue menyngeher in this heuy dwellynge…
BLHar1260.Last Lines: …we wyet lorde in to thi handeoure sawles when we sal heyen wende
BLHar1260.Note: Ends, “Amen”; not on f. 107 as previously cited; in last line “weyen” may be scribal error for “weþen” but clearly written “y” not “þ.”
BLHar1260.Editions:
Robbins,  Rossell Hope. 
             “Middle English Versions of ‘Christe qui lux es’.” 
             Harvard Theological Review
         47 (1954): 55-63: 57-8.
